git.description: Distributed version control system - tracks changes in files

git add.description: Add file contents to the index

git push.description: Update remote refs along with associated objects

git pull.description: Fetch from and integrate with another repository

git clone.description: Clone a repository into a new directory

git checkout.description: Switch branches or restore working tree files

git merge.description: Join two or more development histories together

git diff.description: Show changes between commits, commit and working tree, etc

git reset.description: Reset current HEAD to the specified state

docker.description: Container platform for building, sharing, and running applications

docker run.description: Run a command in a new container

docker build.description: Build an image from a Dockerfile

docker pull.description: Pull an image or a repository from a registry

docker push.description: Push an image or a repository to a registry

docker stop.description: Stop one or more running containers

docker start.description: Start one or more stopped containers

docker exec.description: Run a command in a running container

docker logs.description: Fetch the logs of a container

docker inspect.description: Return low-level information on Docker objects

kubectl.description: Kubernetes command-line tool for cluster management

kubectl get pods.description: List all pods in the current namespace

kubectl get services.description: List all services in the current namespace

kubectl get deployments.description: List all deployments in the current namespace

kubectl get nodes.description: List all nodes in the cluster

kubectl describe.description: Show details of a specific resource

kubectl apply.description: Apply a configuration to a resource by filename or stdin

kubectl delete.description: Delete resources by filenames, stdin, resources and names

kubectl logs.description: Print the logs for a container in a pod

kubectl exec.description: Execute a command in a container

kubectl port-forward.description: Forward one or more local ports to a pod

kubectl scale.description: Set a new size for a Deployment, ReplicaSet or Replication Controller

ps -ef.description: Display full format listing of processes

top.description: Display Linux processes in real time

systemctl status.description: Show status of a systemd service

systemctl enable.description: Enable a systemd service to start at boot

systemctl disable.description: Disable a systemd service from starting at boot

ls -la.description: List all files in long format including hidden files

ls -l.description: List files in long format with details

rm -rf.description: Remove files and directories forcefully and recursively

netstat -tulpn.description: Display network connections, routing tables, interface statistics

ping.description: Send ICMP echo requests to network hosts

curl.description: Transfer data from or to a server

ls -a.description: List all files including hidden ones

mkdir -p.description: Create directories and parent directories as needed

touch.description: Create empty files or update timestamps

less.description: View file contents page by page

more.description: View file contents page by page

head.description: Display first lines of a file

tail.description: Display last lines of a file

wc.description: Count lines, words, and characters in files

sed.description: Stream editor for filtering and transforming text

whereis.description: Locate binary, source, manual for a command

free.description: Display amount of free and used memory

uptime.description: Show how long system has been running

aws.description: Amazon Web Services command line interface

aws s3api create-bucket.description: Create S3 bucket with advanced options

aws ec2 authorize-security-group-ingress.description: Add inbound rule to security group

aws ec2 revoke-security-group-ingress.description: Remove inbound rule from security group

aws logs describe-log-streams.description: List log streams in log group

aws logs get-log-events.description: Get log events from log stream

aws route53 list-resource-record-sets.description: List DNS records in hosted zone

apt autoremove.description: Remove automatically installed packages no longer needed

join.description: Join lines of two files on a common field

comm.description: Compare two sorted files line by line

w.description: Show who is logged on and what they are doing

mkswap.description: Set up a Linux swap area

ethtool.description: Display or change ethernet card settings

nice.description: Run command with modified scheduling priority

screenfetch.description: Display system information with ASCII art

batch.description: Execute jobs when system load permits

jetson_clocks.description: Maximize Jetson performance by setting clocks

tegrastats.description: Display Jetson system statistics (CPU, GPU, memory, temperature)

jetson_release.description: Show Jetson board and software information

watch.description: Execute a program periodically and show output

xargs.description: Build and execute command lines from standard input

yes.description: Output a string repeatedly until killed

tee.description: Read from stdin and write to stdout and files

od.description: Dump files in octal and other formats

patch.description: Apply a diff file to an original

cmp.description: Compare two files byte by byte

ros2.description: ROS 2 (Robot Operating System) - framework for robot software development

ros2 launch.description: Launch ROS 2 launch files to start multiple nodes

ros2 topic echo.description: Display messages published to a ROS 2 topic

ros2 topic pub.description: Publish messages to a ROS 2 topic

ros2 node info.description: Show information about a ROS 2 node

ros2 service call.description: Call a ROS 2 service with request data

ros2 param list.description: List all parameters for ROS 2 nodes

ros2 param get.description: Get the value of a ROS 2 parameter

ros2 param set.description: Set the value of a ROS 2 parameter

ros2 bag record.description: Record ROS 2 topics to a bag file for later playback

ros2 bag play.description: Play back recorded ROS 2 topics from a bag file

ros2 run demo_nodes_cpp talker.description: Run ROS 2 C++ talker demo node

ros2 run demo_nodes_py listener.description: Run ROS 2 Python listener demo node

ros2 run rmw_zenoh_cpp rmw_zenohd.description: Run Zenoh router daemon for ROS 2 discovery and communication

source /opt/ros/humble/setup.bash.description: Setup ROS 2 Humble environment variables and paths

colcon.description: ROS 2 build tool for building workspaces with multiple packages

colcon build.description: Build all packages in a ROS 2 workspace

colcon build --symlink-install.description: Build ROS 2 workspace with symlinked install for faster iteration

colcon build --cmake-args.description: Build ROS 2 workspace with custom CMake arguments

colcon test.description: Run tests for all packages in ROS 2 workspace

colcon version-check.description: Check for newer versions of colcon and extensions

rosdep install.description: Install system dependencies for ROS packages

rosdep install --from-paths src --ignore.description: Install all dependencies for ROS 2 workspace from src directory

pro attach.description: Attach Ubuntu Pro subscription to this machine

pro detach.description: Detach Ubuntu Pro subscription from this machine

pro status.description: Show Ubuntu Pro subscription status and enabled services

pro enable realtime-kernel.description: Enable Ubuntu Pro real-time kernel for low-latency applications

git lfs.description: Git Large File Storage - track large files in Git repositories

git lfs install.description: Install Git LFS hooks for the current user

git lfs track.description: Track files with Git LFS using patterns

git lfs untrack.description: Stop tracking files with Git LFS

git lfs ls-files.description: List files being tracked by Git LFS

git clone --recurse-submodules.description: Clone a repository including all submodules recursively

add-apt-repository.description: Add a new APT repository to system sources

apt install software-properties-common.description: Install tools for managing Ubuntu software repositories

sudo apt update.description: Update package index with root privileges

sudo apt upgrade.description: Upgrade installed packages with root privileges

sudo apt autoremove.description: Remove unused packages with root privileges

sudo apt install software-properties-com.description: Install repository management tools with root privileges

sudo add-apt-repository.description: Add APT repository with root privileges

sudo add-apt-repository universe.description: Enable Ubuntu Universe repository with root privileges
